Explore River X Events Catalog for details. Refer to River X Data Model page for specifics on event message fields. published: true date: 2025-01-21T13:48:11.784Z tags: events, event-catalog editor: markdown dateCreated: 2022-11-02T14:43:54.976Z --- # Event Headers Riverx events follows [Cloud Events Format](https://github.com/cloudevents/spec/blob/v1.0.2/cloudevents/spec.md) for all generated events. Below are common fields and information about the fields. | Field | Description | | ------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | | `ce_type` | Indicates the category or parent type of the event in reverse-DNS name format | | `ce_source` | Refers to the URI-reference for the RiverX API, providing the latest data for the originating event | | `ce_time` | Represents the timestamp for the generated event, following the ISO-8601 instant format (e.g., "2011-12-03T10:15:30Z" in UTC) | | `ce_id` | Utilizes a UUID as a unique identifier for the event, ensuring system-wide traceability | | `ce_subject` | Specifies the subcategory or detailed event type of the generated event | | `ce_specversion` | Denotes the version of the applied format for the generated event | | `key_description` | Defines the partition key of the generated event | | `traceparent` | Contains the trace parent ID of the generated event, enabling system-wide monitoring | | `av_event_version` | Signifies the version of the Avsos format used for the generated event | | `content-type` | Describes the defined event format specification, such as the JSON event format, for clarity and consistency | > The following attributes are included in the header and the value of the generated event. {.is-info} | Field Header Format | Field Value Format | | -------------------- | -
